intro: Diapedium diversiforme, commonly known as the variable diapedium, is a species of flowering plant belonging to the family Malvaceae. It is native to tropical regions of Africa and is characterized by its distinctive, palmate leaves with lobed margins. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically pink or white in color. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in shaded or semi-shaded environments. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens and greenhouses.
